content.verbatim_text: Personal data shall be: (a) processed lawfully, fairly and in a transparent manner in relation to the data subject ('lawfulness, fairness and transparency'); (b) collected for specified, explicit and legitimate purposes and not further processed in a manner that is incompatible with those purposes ('purpose limitation'); (c) adequate, relevant and limited to what is necessary in relation to the purposes for which they are processed ('data minimisation'); (d) accurate and, where necessary, kept up to date ('accuracy'); (e) kept in a form which permits identification of data subjects for no longer than is necessary ('storage limitation'); (f) processed in a manner that ensures appropriate security ('integrity and confidentiality').
content.title: Principles relating to processing of personal data

structured_data.relevance_to_odgs: Foundational data quality principles — maps directly to ODGS DQ dimensions (Accuracy, Completeness, Timeliness)

interpretation.summary: GDPR Art. 5: Principles relating to processing of personal data
interpretation.applicability: All organizations processing personal data of EU residents
